presenter.bio: Tissue diagnosis in indeterminate biliary stricture CASE DISCUSSION

slide.title: Tissue diagnosis in indeterminate biliary stricture CASE DISCUSSION
slide.titleNormalized: tissue diagnosis in indeterminate biliary stricture case discussion
slide.text:
Tissue diagnosis in indeterminate biliary stricture
CASE DISCUSSION Endoscopy Unit Department of Diagnostic and Therapeutic Services ISMETT - UPMC Palermo, Italy Dario Ligresti

slide.title: Tissue diagnosis in indeterminate biliary stricture
slide.titleNormalized: tissue diagnosis in indeterminate biliary stricture
slide.notes: Two cases: the one about a proximal, the other about a distal biliary stricture
slide.notesNormalized: two cases: the one about a proximal, the other about a distal biliary stricture
slide.notesHtml: Two cases: the one about a proximal, the other about a distal biliary stricture
slide.text: Tissue diagnosis in indeterminate biliary stricture CASE 1 CASE 2

slide.title: Case 1
slide.notes:
First case is about a 72 years Bilirubin was normal with a slightly obstructive pattern of LFTs
Paziente in trattamento chemioterapico con Doxorubicina per carcinoma della mammella metastatico. Noi facciamo FNB della lesione biliare per diagnosi di esclusione di colangiocarcinoma vs. Metastasi da mammella di nuova insorgenza per cui si cambierebbe farmaco di chemioterapia passando da doxorubicina a gemcitabina. La gemcitabina abbraccia sia il colangiocarcinoma che il k mammella. Allora mi chiedo...ma allora potevamo anche non pungerla...NO! Perche anche se fosse una metastasi da k mammella con l’istologico potremmo scoprire una mutazione genotipica di un tumore che non viene caratterizzato istologicamente da anni... La prognosi del carcinoma mammario metastatico è buona...la prognosi del colangiocarcinoma invece no...
slide.notesNormalized:
first case is about a 72 years bilirubin was normal with a slightly obstructive pattern of lfts
paziente in trattamento chemioterapico con doxorubicina per carcinoma della mammella metastatico. noi facciamo fnb della lesione biliare per diagnosi di esclusione di colangiocarcinoma vs. metastasi da mammella di nuova insorgenza per cui si cambierebbe farmaco di chemioterapia passando da doxorubicina a gemcitabina. la gemcitabina abbraccia sia il colangiocarcinoma che il k mammella. allora mi chiedo...ma allora potevamo anche non pungerla...no! perche anche se fosse una metastasi da k mammella con l’istologico potremmo scoprire una mutazione genotipica di un tumore che non viene caratterizzato istologicamente da anni... la prognosi del carcinoma mammario metastatico è buona...la prognosi del colangiocarcinoma invece no...
slide.notesHtml:
First case is about a 72 years

Bilirubin was normal with a slightly obstructive pattern of LFTs

Paziente in trattamento chemioterapico con Doxorubicina per carcinoma della mammella metastatico. Noi facciamo FNB della lesione biliare per diagnosi di esclusione di colangiocarcinoma vs. Metastasi da mammella di nuova insorgenza per cui si cambierebbe farmaco di chemioterapia passando da doxorubicina a gemcitabina. La gemcitabina abbraccia sia il colangiocarcinoma che il k mammella. Allora mi chiedo...ma allora potevamo anche non pungerla...NO! Perche anche se fosse una metastasi da k mammella con l’istologico potremmo scoprire una mutazione genotipica di un tumore che non viene caratterizzato istologicamente da anni... La prognosi del carcinoma mammario metastatico è buona...la prognosi del colangiocarcinoma invece no...
slide.text:
72-year-old woman
Metastatic breast cancer in effective treatment with Doxorubicin
Incidental CT finding of biliary stenosis during follow-up
Normal bilirubin levels; GGT (x5 N); FA (x2 N)
Good general conditions
Case 1

slide.title: CT scan
slide.notes: This is the contrast enhanced CT scan showing a mild dilatation of the intraepatic billiary tree with some liver metastases from breast cancer
slide.notesNormalized: this is the contrast enhanced ct scan showing a mild dilatation of the intraepatic billiary tree with some liver metastases from breast cancer
slide.notesHtml: This is the contrast enhanced CT scan showing a mild dilatation of the intraepatic billiary tree with some liver metastases from breast cancer
slide.text: CT scan

slide.title: What is your next investigation?
slide.text: What is your next investigation? MRI EUS ERCP

slide.title: EUS
slide.notes: From the GE junction a liver metastasis of the segment 2 is visible with associated intraephatic biliary dilatation. From the duodeal bulb CBD and PD are visible joining togheter into the papilla. From here with a counterclockwise rotation we can follow the two structures up to the hilum of the liver. Here’s the head of the pancreas with the portal confluence below. If we keep on torqueing counterclockwise with the CBD into view we find a solid lesion into that, close to the proper hepatic artery and the PV. We then procede with contrast enhanced EUS with SonoVue. You can see the counter running in the upper left angle of the video. Now the contrast is visible into the hepatic artery and the lesion is showing a slow progessive enhancement that is diffuse and inhomogeneous
slide.notesNormalized: from the ge junction a liver metastasis of the segment 2 is visible with associated intraephatic biliary dilatation. from the duodeal bulb cbd and pd are visible joining togheter into the papilla. from here with a counterclockwise rotation we can follow the two structures up to the hilum of the liver. here’s the head of the pancreas with the portal confluence below. if we keep on torqueing counterclockwise with the cbd into view we find a solid lesion into that, close to the proper hepatic artery and the pv. we then procede with contrast enhanced eus with sonovue. you can see the counter running in the upper left angle of the video. now the contrast is visible into the hepatic artery and the lesion is showing a slow progessive enhancement that is diffuse and inhomogeneous
slide.notesHtml:
From the GE junction a liver metastasis of the segment 2 is visible with associated intraephatic biliary dilatation.

From the duodeal bulb CBD and PD are visible joining togheter into the papilla. From here with a counterclockwise rotation we can follow the two structures up to the hilum of the liver. Here’s the head of the pancreas with the portal confluence below. If we keep on torqueing counterclockwise with the CBD into view we find a solid lesion into that, close to the proper hepatic artery and the PV. We then procede with contrast enhanced EUS with SonoVue. You can see the counter running in the upper left angle of the video. Now the contrast is visible into the hepatic artery and the lesion is showing a slow progessive enhancement that is diffuse and inhomogeneous
slide.text: EUS

slide.title: What would you do next?
slide.text: What would you do next? EUS – FNA/B ERCP

slide.title: EUS
slide.text:
22 G Aquire
3 passes
FNB EUS

slide.title: What would you do then?
slide.text:
What would you do then? Same-session ERCP
ERCP in case of EUS-FNA inadequate results

slide.title: ERCP
slide.notes: The cholangiography showed in the upper third of the cbd a stricture about 10 mm long with apple core appearance
slide.notesNormalized: the cholangiography showed in the upper third of the cbd a stricture about 10 mm long with apple core appearance
slide.notesHtml: The cholangiography showed in the upper third of the cbd a stricture about 10 mm long with apple core appearance
slide.text:
ERCP ERCP Biliary stricture
10 mm lenght «Apple core» appearance

slide.title: ERCP
slide.text: ERCP Which of these following techniques would you use for further tissue acquisition? Cholangioscopy Brushing + biopsies

slide.title: ERCP
slide.text: Brushing ERCP

slide.title: ERCP
slide.notes: After that We performed IDA, a technique we reported in 2012. After standard brushing, to perform IDA, we removed the brush from its catheter and used the tip of the catheter as a scraping device. The tip was scraped back and forth across the stricture at least 10 times. The catheter and a suction line were connected to a specimen trap to obtain intraductal aspiration of fluids and Samplings for cytodiagnosis.
slide.notesNormalized: after that we performed ida, a technique we reported in 2012. after standard brushing, to perform ida, we removed the brush from its catheter and used the tip of the catheter as a scraping device. the tip was scraped back and forth across the stricture at least 10 times. the catheter and a suction line were connected to a specimen trap to obtain intraductal aspiration of fluids and samplings for cytodiagnosis.
slide.notesHtml:
After that We performed IDA, a technique we reported in 2012. After standard brushing, to perform IDA, we removed the brush from its catheter and used

the tip of the catheter as a scraping device. The tip was scraped back and forth across the stricture at least 10 times.

The catheter and a suction line were connected to a specimen trap to obtain intraductal aspiration of fluids and

Samplings for cytodiagnosis.
slide.text: IDA – Intraductal aspiration ERCP Curcio et al. Gastroint Endosc. 2012; 75: 798-804

slide.title: ERCP
slide.notes: We also performed biopsies of the stricture with a standard forceps
slide.notesNormalized: we also performed biopsies of the stricture with a standard forceps
slide.notesHtml: We also performed biopsies of the stricture with a standard forceps
slide.text: Biopsies ERCP

slide.title: ERCP
slide.notes: And finally placed an uncovered metal stent
slide.notesNormalized: and finally placed an uncovered metal stent
slide.notesHtml: And finally placed an uncovered metal stent
slide.text:
ERCP SEMS
Uncovered 8 cm x 10 mm

slide.title: Pathologic assessment
slide.notes: Pathologic assessment revealed suboptimal material from FNB only showing fbrosis. Brushing was inadequate
slide.notesNormalized: pathologic assessment revealed suboptimal material from fnb only showing fbrosis. brushing was inadequate
slide.notesHtml: Pathologic assessment revealed suboptimal material from FNB only showing fbrosis. Brushing was inadequate
slide.text:
Suboptimal (fibrosis) 22 G Aquire
FNB EUS ERCP Brushing Inadequate Biopsies Diagnostic Diagnostic Intraductal aspiration (IDA) Pathologic assessment

slide.title: Pathologic assessment
slide.text: Pathologic assessment (Papaniculau stain) cluster of ADENOCARCINOMA cells appearing as nested epithelial cells with significantly enlarged nuclei and irregular nuclear margins. Biopsies Intraductal aspiration (IDA) (H&E) Moderately differentiated components of ADENOCARCINOMA

slide.title: Intraductal aspiration (IDA)
slide.notes:
According to our data IDA provides a significantly higher sensitivity and specificity than brushin even if it was calculated in a small cohort of 42 patients.
In our 42 patients, IDA provided a significantly higher sensitivity than brushing (89% vs 78% for adequate samples and 89% vs 37% for all samples), providing a significantly superior cellular adequacy (92.8% vs 35.7%) (Fig. 2). Cellular adequacy was evaluated on site for brushing and IDA.
slide.notesNormalized:
according to our data ida provides a significantly higher sensitivity and specificity than brushin even if it was calculated in a small cohort of 42 patients.
in our 42 patients, ida provided a significantly higher sensitivity than brushing (89% vs 78% for adequate samples and 89% vs 37% for all samples), providing a significantly superior cellular adequacy (92.8% vs 35.7%) (fig. 2). cellular adequacy was evaluated on site for brushing and ida.
slide.notesHtml:
According to our data IDA provides a significantly higher sensitivity and specificity than brushin even if it was calculated in a small cohort of 42 patients.

In our 42 patients, IDA provided a significantly higher

sensitivity than brushing (89% vs 78% for adequate samples

and 89% vs 37% for all samples), providing a significantly

superior cellular adequacy (92.8% vs 35.7%) (Fig.

2). Cellular adequacy was evaluated on site for brushing

and IDA.
slide.text: Intraductal aspiration (IDA) Curcio et al. Gastroint Endosc. 2012; 75: 798-804

slide.title: Final Diagnosis
slide.notes: Final diagnosis was cholangiocarcinoma and the patient started proper chemoterapy
slide.notesNormalized: final diagnosis was cholangiocarcinoma and the patient started proper chemoterapy
slide.notesHtml: Final diagnosis was cholangiocarcinoma and the patient started proper chemoterapy
slide.text: Final Diagnosis Cholangiocarcinoma Is there room for EUS-FNA/B based cito-histological diagnosis in patients with biliary stenosis of the upper third of the CBD?

slide.title: Case 2
slide.notes: Second case is about a 63 year old woman with no history of alchool abuse or smoke, complaining recurrent upper quadrant abdominal pain and a weight loss of about 10 kg in the last 4 months
slide.notesNormalized: second case is about a 63 year old woman with no history of alchool abuse or smoke, complaining recurrent upper quadrant abdominal pain and a weight loss of about 10 kg in the last 4 months
slide.notesHtml: Second case is about a 63 year old woman with no history of alchool abuse or smoke, complaining recurrent upper quadrant abdominal pain and a weight loss of about 10 kg in the last 4 months
slide.text:
Case 2
63-year-old woman (no alchool abuse, no smoke)
Recurrent upper quadrant abdominal pain
Weight loss: 10 Kg in the last 4 months

slide.title: Laboratory findings
slide.notes: She presented with an obstructivce pattern of liver function tests and normal amilase and lipase
slide.notesNormalized: she presented with an obstructivce pattern of liver function tests and normal amilase and lipase
slide.notesHtml: She presented with an obstructivce pattern of liver function tests and normal amilase and lipase
slide.text:
Laboratory findings
Total/direct bilirubin 2.05/1.61 mg/dl
AST/ALT 152/345 mU/ml
ɣ-GT 47 mU/ml, ALP 302 mU/ml
Amylase/lipase within normal limits.

slide.title: Abdominal US
slide.notes: An abdominal ultrasonography revealed distended gallbladder with sludge and associated intrahepatic dilatation. CBD was also dilated up to 9 mm.
slide.notesNormalized: an abdominal ultrasonography revealed distended gallbladder with sludge and associated intrahepatic dilatation. cbd was also dilated up to 9 mm.
slide.notesHtml: An abdominal ultrasonography revealed distended gallbladder with sludge and associated intrahepatic dilatation. CBD was also dilated up to 9 mm.

slide.title: What would you do next?
slide.notes: What would you do next? EUS and eventual ERCP for Suspected CBD stones/sludge ?
slide.notesNormalized: what would you do next? eus and eventual ercp for suspected cbd stones/sludge ?
slide.notesHtml:
What would you do next?

EUS and eventual ERCP for Suspected CBD stones/sludge ?
slide.text: What would you do next? EUS ERCP CE-CT scan +/- MRI

slide.title: CT scan
slide.notes:
We performed a CT scan that revealed the presence of some hypervascular areas in the body-tail of the pancreas that were diffusely enlarged, with featureless borders and a low-density capsule-like rim
TC addome con mdc: pancreas aumentato di volume diffusamente (DT coda 22 mm, DT testa 35 mm), con perdita delle lobulazioni. In fase arteriosa lesione ipervascolare alla testa di 12 mm e altre due alla coda con dilatazione del dotto di Wirsung a monte. Discreta dilazione vie biliari intraepatiche. Il dotto epatico comune, subito sotto l’ilo, presenta ispessimento concentrico delle pareti (4-6 mm) e restringimento del lume. Pareti del coledoco intrapancreatico caratterizzate da enhancement.
slide.notesNormalized:
we performed a ct scan that revealed the presence of some hypervascular areas in the body-tail of the pancreas that were diffusely enlarged, with featureless borders and a low-density capsule-like rim
tc addome con mdc: pancreas aumentato di volume diffusamente (dt coda 22 mm, dt testa 35 mm), con perdita delle lobulazioni. in fase arteriosa lesione ipervascolare alla testa di 12 mm e altre due alla coda con dilatazione del dotto di wirsung a monte. discreta dilazione vie biliari intraepatiche. il dotto epatico comune, subito sotto l’ilo, presenta ispessimento concentrico delle pareti (4-6 mm) e restringimento del lume. pareti del coledoco intrapancreatico caratterizzate da enhancement.
slide.notesHtml:
We performed a CT scan that revealed the presence of some hypervascular areas in the body-tail of the pancreas that were diffusely enlarged, with featureless borders and a low-density capsule-like rim

TC addome con mdc: pancreas aumentato di volume

diffusamente (DT coda 22 mm, DT testa 35 mm), con perdita delle lobulazioni. In fase arteriosa lesione ipervascolare alla testa di 12 mm e altre due alla coda con dilatazione del dotto di Wirsung a monte. Discreta dilazione vie biliari intraepatiche. Il dotto epatico comune, subito sotto l’ilo, presenta ispessimento concentrico delle pareti (4-6 mm) e restringimento del lume. Pareti del coledoco intrapancreatico caratterizzate da enhancement.
slide.text: CT scan Featureless borders Capsule-like rim Hypervascular areas Diffuse Enlargement

slide.title: CT scan
slide.notes: A concentric wall thickening of the CBD was reveled with associated mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation and an enlarged head of the pancreas.
slide.notesNormalized: a concentric wall thickening of the cbd was reveled with associated mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation and an enlarged head of the pancreas.
slide.notesHtml: A concentric wall thickening of the CBD was reveled with associated mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation and an enlarged head of the pancreas.
slide.text: CT scan Concentric wall thickening of the CBD Enlarged head of the pancreas

slide.title: What would you do next?
slide.text: What would you do next? MRI EUS ERCP

slide.title: MRCP
slide.notes:
To better define the biliary tree and the PD we performed an MRI showing a loss of signal in the distal third of the CBD with upstread dilatation and no dilatation of the PD
RMN addome superiore+colangio-pancreatoRMN: esame inficiato da crisi claustrofobica. Per quanto visibile inserzione bassa e mediale del cistico. Lieve dilatazione del coledoco. Non visibile in tratto intrapancreatico del coledoco e il tratto del Wirsung in corrispondenza della testa del pancreas che e’ poco valutabile.
slide.notesNormalized:
to better define the biliary tree and the pd we performed an mri showing a loss of signal in the distal third of the cbd with upstread dilatation and no dilatation of the pd
rmn addome superiore+colangio-pancreatormn: esame inficiato da crisi claustrofobica. per quanto visibile inserzione bassa e mediale del cistico. lieve dilatazione del coledoco. non visibile in tratto intrapancreatico del coledoco e il tratto del wirsung in corrispondenza della testa del pancreas che e’ poco valutabile.
slide.notesHtml:
To better define the biliary tree and the PD we performed an MRI showing a loss of signal in the distal third of the CBD with upstread dilatation and no dilatation of the PD

RMN addome superiore+colangio-pancreatoRMN:

esame inficiato da crisi claustrofobica. Per quanto visibile

inserzione bassa e mediale del cistico. Lieve dilatazione del

coledoco. Non visibile in tratto intrapancreatico del

coledoco e il tratto del Wirsung in corrispondenza della

testa del pancreas che e’ poco valutabile.
slide.text:
MRCP Loss of signal
Distal third of the CBD No Pancreatic Duct dilatation

slide.title: What would you do first?
slide.text: What would you do first? EUS ERCP

slide.title: EUS
slide.notes: We went for an EUS showing a sandiwich-like CBD wall thickening up to 4 mm. In particular CBD stops in the pancreas head that is enlarged with inhomogeneous echogenicity, and hyperechoic strends and dots
slide.notesNormalized: we went for an eus showing a sandiwich-like cbd wall thickening up to 4 mm. in particular cbd stops in the pancreas head that is enlarged with inhomogeneous echogenicity, and hyperechoic strends and dots
slide.notesHtml: We went for an EUS showing a sandiwich-like CBD wall thickening up to 4 mm. In particular CBD stops in the pancreas head that is enlarged with inhomogeneous echogenicity, and hyperechoic strends and dots
slide.text:
EUS Pancreas Head CBD A B C «Sandwich-like» CBD wall thickening
up to 4 mm A B C

slide.title: EUS
slide.notes: We then performed an FNB with a 22G Pro Core needle aiming the head of te pancreas and the cbd wall
slide.notesNormalized: we then performed an fnb with a 22g pro core needle aiming the head of te pancreas and the cbd wall
slide.notesHtml: We then performed an FNB with a 22G Pro Core needle aiming the head of te pancreas and the cbd wall
slide.text: EUS 22 G Pro Core FNA/B Pancreas head CBD wall

slide.title: ERCP
slide.notes: The following ERCP showed an irregular biliary stricture of the distal third of the CBD about 30 mm long
slide.notesNormalized: the following ercp showed an irregular biliary stricture of the distal third of the cbd about 30 mm long
slide.notesHtml: The following ERCP showed an irregular biliary stricture of the distal third of the CBD about 30 mm long
slide.text:
ERCP Biliary stricture
Lower third of the CBD 30 mm lenght Irregular appearance

slide.title: ERCP
slide.text: ERCP What would you do now? Cholangioscopy Brushing + biopsies

slide.title: ERCP
slide.text: ERCP Brushing Biopsies IDA – Intraductal aspiration Biopsies of major papilla

slide.title: Waiting for the pathologic assessement...
slide.notes:
• Waiting for the pathologic assesment we found that CEA and CA 19.9 were normale; antinuclear antibodies and rheumatoid factor were negative and Serum IgG4 were elevated five times the upper limit
• Ca 19.9-CEA: negativi • ANA: negativo • Gammaglobuline: nei limiti • Fattore reumatoide: normale
slide.notesNormalized:
• waiting for the pathologic assesment we found that cea and ca 19.9 were normale; antinuclear antibodies and rheumatoid factor were negative and serum igg4 were elevated five times the upper limit
• ca 19.9-cea: negativi • ana: negativo • gammaglobuline: nei limiti • fattore reumatoide: normale
slide.notesHtml:
• Waiting for the pathologic assesment we found that CEA and CA 19.9 were normale; antinuclear antibodies and rheumatoid factor were negative and Serum IgG4 were elevated five times the upper limit

• Ca 19.9-CEA: negativi

• ANA: negativo

• Gammaglobuline: nei limiti

• Fattore reumatoide: normale
slide.text: Waiting for the pathologic assessement... Serum IgG4 5,74 g/L (range 0.08-1,4) Ca 19.9 CEA Within normal limits Antinuclear antibodies Rheumatoid Factor Negative

slide.title: Pathologic assessment
slide.notes: Pathology evaluation found that the FNB of the head of the pancreas was adequate and showed fibrosis, a lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate and abundant IgG4+ plasmacells. FNB of the CBD wal was found inadequate
slide.notesNormalized: pathology evaluation found that the fnb of the head of the pancreas was adequate and showed fibrosis, a lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate and abundant igg4+ plasmacells. fnb of the cbd wal was found inadequate
slide.notesHtml:
Pathology evaluation found that the FNB of the head of the pancreas was adequate and showed fibrosis, a lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate and abundant IgG4+ plasmacells.

FNB of the CBD wal was found inadequate
slide.text: EUS Pathologic assessment FNA/B Head of the pancreas CBD Wall Fibrosis Lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate IgG4+ plasmacells (> 10 HFP) Adequate Inadequate

slide.title: Pathologic assessment
slide.notes:
Brushing and IDA were also inadequate but biopsies were dagnostic. In particular intraductal biopsies showed storiform fibrosis, lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate and abundant IgG4 components. Biopsies of the major papilla were also positive showing lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate and IgG4 positive plasmacells
BIOPSIE BILIARI: Spesso coinvolta dal processo infiammatorio in quanto punto di congiunzione tra via biliare e Wirsung. Semplici, sicure, con una sensibilità tra il 52 e 80% e una specificità tra 89 e 100%. Non riportati casi di sanguinamento o pancreatite.
slide.notesNormalized:
brushing and ida were also inadequate but biopsies were dagnostic. in particular intraductal biopsies showed storiform fibrosis, lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate and abundant igg4 components. biopsies of the major papilla were also positive showing lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate and igg4 positive plasmacells
biopsie biliari: spesso coinvolta dal processo infiammatorio in quanto punto di congiunzione tra via biliare e wirsung. semplici, sicure, con una sensibilità tra il 52 e 80% e una specificità tra 89 e 100%. non riportati casi di sanguinamento o pancreatite.
slide.notesHtml:
Brushing and IDA were also inadequate but biopsies were dagnostic. In particular intraductal biopsies showed storiform fibrosis, lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate and abundant IgG4 components. Biopsies of the major papilla were also positive showing lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate and IgG4 positive plasmacells

BIOPSIE BILIARI: Spesso coinvolta dal processo infiammatorio in quanto punto di congiunzione tra via biliare e Wirsung.

Semplici, sicure, con una sensibilità tra il 52 e 80% e una specificità tra 89 e 100%.

Non riportati casi di sanguinamento o pancreatite.
slide.text:
ERCP Pathologic assessment Brushing Inadequate Intraductal aspiration (IDA) Inadequate Biopsies Diagnostic Diagnostic Storiform fibrosis Lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate IgG4+ plasmacells (> 10 HFP)
Lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate IgG4+ plasmacells (> 10 HFP)

slide.title: Intraductal biopsies
slide.text: Intraductal biopsies ERCP H&E. Infiltration of plasmacells and lymphocytes with storiform fibrosis Immunostaining for IgG4 showing infiltration of IgG4-positive plasmacells

slide.title: Final Diagnosis
slide.notes: Considering all of this the final diagnosis was Type 1 autoimmune pancreatitis with associated IgG4 cholangiopathy accordingly with the ICDC guidelines included response to steroid therapy.
slide.notesNormalized: considering all of this the final diagnosis was type 1 autoimmune pancreatitis with associated igg4 cholangiopathy accordingly with the icdc guidelines included response to steroid therapy.
slide.notesHtml: Considering all of this the final diagnosis was Type 1 autoimmune pancreatitis with associated IgG4 cholangiopathy accordingly with the ICDC guidelines included response to steroid therapy.
slide.text: Final Diagnosis Pancreas 2011 Apr;40(3):352-8. Type 1 Autoimmune Pancreatitis and associated IgG4 cholangiopathy Parenchimal Imaging Ductal Imaging (ERP) Serology Other Organ Involvement Histology of the pancreas Response to steroid

slide.title: Treatment
slide.notes: In fact the patient was treated with point 6 mg per kilograms per day for 4 weeks with subsequent tapering of 5 mg every two weeks until a maintenance dose of 5 mg per day
slide.notesNormalized: in fact the patient was treated with point 6 mg per kilograms per day for 4 weeks with subsequent tapering of 5 mg every two weeks until a maintenance dose of 5 mg per day
slide.notesHtml: In fact the patient was treated with point 6 mg per kilograms per day for 4 weeks with subsequent tapering of 5 mg every two weeks until a maintenance dose of 5 mg per day
slide.text:
Treatment Prednisolone 0.6 mg/Kg/die for 4 weeks
Tapering of 5 mg every two weeks until maintenance dose (5 mg/day)

slide.title: Follow up
slide.notes: During follow up the patient turned to be asymptomatic and we observed a progressive weight regain with a decrease of IgG4 levels until normal values at one year
slide.notesNormalized: during follow up the patient turned to be asymptomatic and we observed a progressive weight regain with a decrease of igg4 levels until normal values at one year
slide.notesHtml: During follow up the patient turned to be asymptomatic and we observed a progressive weight regain with a decrease of IgG4 levels until normal values at one year
slide.text: Follow up Start of therapy No abdominal pain Weight regain (partial) Normal blood test 2 months Asymptomatic Weight regain (complete) Serum IgG4 2.65 g/L CT scan 4 weeks 6 months Asymptomatic Serum IgG4 1.72 g/L CT scan 1 year Asymptomatic IgG4 normal

slide.title: Follow up
slide.notes:
Here you can see follow-up ct scans showing progressive volume reduction of the body-tail
Deltacortene 0.6 mg/Kg/die per 4 settimane poi riduzione di 5 mg ogni 7 giorni fino a raggiungere dose di mantenimento tra 2.5 e 10 mg/die.
slide.notesNormalized:
here you can see follow-up ct scans showing progressive volume reduction of the body-tail
deltacortene 0.6 mg/kg/die per 4 settimane poi riduzione di 5 mg ogni 7 giorni fino a raggiungere dose di mantenimento tra 2.5 e 10 mg/die.
slide.notesHtml:
Here you can see follow-up ct scans showing progressive volume reduction of the body-tail

Deltacortene 0.6 mg/Kg/die per 4 settimane poi

riduzione di 5 mg ogni 7 giorni fino a raggiungere dose di

mantenimento tra 2.5 e 10 mg/die.
slide.text: Follow up 41 At diagnosis 2 months later 6 months later Body-tail volume reduction

cbd wall thickness reduced too as you ca see in this eus picures
deltacortene 0.6 mg/kg/die per 4 settimane poi riduzione di 5 mg ogni 7 giorni fino a raggiungere dose di mantenimento tra 2.5 e 10 mg/die.

riduzione di 5 mg ogni 7 giorni fino a raggiungere dose di

mantenimento tra 2.5 e 10 mg/die.
slide.text: Follow up At diagnosis (4.2 mm) 2 months later (2 mm) 6 months later (1.4 mm) CBD wall thickness reduction

slide.title: Thank you!
